text: St. Ignatius College, San Sebastian ("Donostia" in Basque), on the northwest coast of Spain was founded by the Society of Jesus in 1929 and currently includes pre-primary through the baccalaureate. It is also affiliated with the nurseries of the Servants of Jesus and of the Carmelite Teresiana Missionaries. On 1 October 1929 classes began at San Ignacio de Loyola School in San Sebastián. The first lay director, Amaia Arzamendi, was appointed in 2009. ==References== Category:Jesuit secondary schools in Spain Category:Catholic schools in Spain Category:Educational institutions established in 1929
title: St. Ignatius College, San Sebastian
